column4: don't i lose anything if i erase those files? what are they for, anyway? ("brenner wants you to know: [...]  gpgerr is a GPG-related error that sometimes occur when accessing the Ubuntu archives; it can usually be solved by typing "sudo rm /var/lib/apt/lists/*Release*" (without the quotes!) in a terminal")
iirc, it's apt's cache
meaning it's not vital?
*nod* it will probably be regenrated next time you update
you still getting that error hey?
yes :(
and i get warnings in synaptic
post both the errors and your sources.list file to a pastebin

any idea what this is ?: "could not download all repository indexes: http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/breezy-security/main/binary-i386/Packages.gz: Sub-process bzip2 returned an error code (2)"
ohh, i did it here
M_Cheevy: i mean, isn't that link necessary?
yes, they're equivalent afaik
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5808
sounds like your sources.list file has something wrong.
do you have a pastebin link for that?
this is the content of my sources list: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5809
i just added everything from ubuntulinux.nl/source-o-matic
looks like you appended the output to the old one though, instead of *replacing* it.
you've got multiple entries
yes... i thought this was not a problem. i thought it was actually good, like having more than one mirror (just in case)...
apparently not, because that's one of the errors you're getting
actually, if i erase content of the default sources file and replace it with the one from source-o-matic (adding everything!) do ai lose *anything*?
np.  i think M_Cheevy and nickrud finished it off though :)
